points.title: Your private content may be accessed by people working for the service
points.status: The TL;DR of the Privacy Policy states that: " We will never read or access your private notes without written or verbal consent."

points.title: Information is provided about security practices
points.status: The note about Data policy states that: "You data is stored in the cloud (AWS), it's encrypted during transfer (TLS) and also at rest (default RDS encryption for document content and personal data, and SSE-S3 encryption for uploaded binary content). However at this point we do not provide end-to-end encryption of your data and files or assets you choose to embed in your documents rely on security through obscurity."

points.title: Logs are kept for an undefined period of time
points.status: The  privacy policy states that "We collect and log Internet or other electronic network information on how you and others access and use Craft, for example, the act of visiting a shared document. Usage data may be collected through cookies, and similar technologies. For more information, including how to opt-out, visit our Cookie Information page."

points.title: You maintain ownership of your content
points.status: The TL;DR of the policy privacy states that: "Craft does not own your data, nor do we sell it to others or use it for advertising. We will never read or access your private notes without written or verbal consent - it's your data, period."
